descriptions: Does not identify any structural elements within the primary source.
Identifies only one basic structural element (e.g., paragraph) with no explanation of its function.
Identifies a few structural elements (e.g., sentences, paragraphs) but struggles to explain their individual contributions to the whole.
Identifies several key structural elements and provides a general explanation of their contributions to the overall text.
Identifies key structural elements (sentences, paragraphs, sections) and explains how each contributes to the development of the central ideas.

Provides a thorough and insightful analysis of how key sentences, paragraphs, and larger sections of the text contribute to the work as a whole, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of the author's structural choices.
Shows no understanding of how the different parts of the text relate to one another.
Shows a limited and/or inaccurate understanding of how different parts of the text relate to each other.
Describes relationships between some textual elements, but lacks depth of analysis.
Explains how some key sentences, paragraphs, and sections connect to each other, contributing to a central idea, but doesn't delve into the complexity of these connections.
Analyzes how the key parts of the primary source relate to one another and how those relationships shape meaning and achieve the author's purpose.
Provides a detailed and insightful analysis of the complex interrelationships between the text’s structural elements, revealing subtle nuances and a deep comprehension of the text's architecture.
Demonstrates no understanding of the text's intended purpose or overall message.
Offers a vague or inaccurate interpretation of the text's purpose.
States the text's purpose in a superficial manner without supporting evidence.
Explains the text's primary purpose with some supporting evidence from the source.
Analyzes the author's purpose and explains how the structure of the text enhances the effectiveness of the message.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of the text's purpose and the ways in which its structure strategically achieves this purpose, with strong textual support.
